bug.author: PascalSchroederDE
bug.summary: Nothing happens when running kubeflow pipeline
bug.description:
I just started working with kubeflow so maybe it's just something trivial, anyway I would be very thankful for your help! I setup kubeflow on a Microk8s as described <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started/>here</denchmark-link> . I wrote my own pipeline, compiled it with (as described <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/pipelines/tutorials/build-pipeline/>here</denchmark-link> ) but when I created a run to test it just nothing happened. I can see the run in the section on the kubeflow dashboard, but when I click on it to see some details I just get a message or a message in the section. Also, there is no new pod created when I enter in my terminal - there are only the default kubeflow pods. So I thought I would have made a mistake in my pipeline and so I downloaded the "sequential" example pipeline from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/samples/basic/sequential.py>here</denchmark-link> . I compiled it with and uploaded it to my kubeflow. But when I create a run I am getting the same behavior as described above. Same problem with the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines/blob/master/samples/basic/parallel_join.py>parallel join example</denchmark-link> . Last, of course, I also tried to run one of the existing samples like "[Sample] Basic - Condition" or "[Sample] Basic - Parallel Join". Still I cant see any graph or output when running those examples, but at least a pod is being created when I create a run. But the pod almost directly jumps to Status "Completed" and so I am getting following error message inside the wait container: <denchmark-code>time="2019-05-27T14:05:23Z" level=info msg="Executor (version: v2.2.0, build_date: 2018-08-30T08:52:54Z) initialized with template:
archiveLocation: {}
container:
 args:
 - python -c "import random; result = 'heads' if random.randint(0,1) == 0 else 'tails';
 print(result)" | tee /tmp/output
 command:
 - sh
 - -c
 image: python:alpine3.6
 name: ""
 resources: {}
inputs: {}
metadata: {}
name: flip
outputs:
 artifacts:
 - name: mlpipeline-ui-metadata
 path: /mlpipeline-ui-metadata.json
 s3:
 accessKeySecret:
 key: accesskey
 name: mlpipeline-minio-artifact
 bucket: mlpipeline
 endpoint: minio-service.kubeflow:9000
 insecure: true
 key: runs/6cb5b5f5-8088-11e9-bda9-94c691a53563/pipeline-flip-coin-mmj4g-3910319742/mlpipeline-ui-metadata.tgz
 secretKeySecret:
 key: secretkey
 name: mlpipeline-minio-artifact
 - name: mlpipeline-metrics

" time="2019-05-27T14:05:23Z" level=info msg="Waiting on main container" time="2019-05-27T14:05:24Z" level=info msg="main container started with container ID: 7cba070ba6822b82fdc2f7f04bf737c69422d2797ba183136dcb3f91a07cca00" time="2019-05-27T14:05:24Z" level=info msg="Starting annotations monitor" time="2019-05-27T14:05:24Z" level=info msg="docker wait 7cba070ba6822b82fdc2f7f04bf737c69422d2797ba183136dcb3f91a07cca00" time="2019-05-27T14:05:24Z" level=info msg="Starting deadline monitor" time="2019-05-27T14:05:25Z" level=error msg="`docker wait 7cba070ba6822b82fdc2f7f04bf737c69422d2797ba183136dcb3f91a07cca00` failed: Error response from daemon: No such container: 7cba070ba6822b82fdc2f7f04bf737c69422d2797ba183136dcb3f91a07cca00

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.62. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Found a compromise solution for me: Using <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/pipelines>Kubeflow pipelines</denchmark-link> seperated
